The Lockdown Effect
Satellite Imagery is the image of Earth(or other planets) which are
collected by imaging satellites. Satellites have been collecting Earth
Observation data for decades. Some changes in the concentration
of air pollutants are visible from satellites.

One such instrument collecting these measurements is the
Tropospheric Monitoring Instrument (TROPOMI) sensor onboard the
Sentinel 5P OFFL NO2 mission satellite currently in orbit. A look at
Nitrogen Dioxide - one of the most common pollutants - through
time using satellite imagery.
A look at Nitrogen Dioxide - one of the most common pollutants -
through time using satellite imagery.

Sentinel-5 Precursor (Sentinel-5P) is an Earth observation satellite
developed by ESA as part of the Copernicus Programme. The
Copernicus Programme is dedicated to monitoring air pollution
and Sentinel 5P Precursor is its first mission. It consists of an
instrument called Tropomi (TROPOspheric Monitoring Instrument)
which is a spectrometer to monitor ozone, methane, formaldehyde,
aerosol, carbon monoxide, NO2 and SO2 in the atmosphere.
The average AQI of India is calculated in order to gain insights into
the seasonality of air pollution.

For example, we can infer that our AQI seems to peak between the
months of November - February almost consistently every year. If
researched well it could provide us with a better understanding
of how pollution works in India
A notable and clear decrease in the AQI values of different
Indian cities shows just how much affect the Lockdown had
on air pollution.
This is also what forms the basis of this project.

The black vertical line shows when the Lockdown came into
effect in India.
